channel.title: Displaying latest news from a MySql database, help needed!

item.title: Displaying latest news from a MySql database, help needed!
item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

making everyone connect to that website each time to get the message is not that great.

add something like public static String Server_News = null; in the World class.

add this to the very first line of code in Server.java

java.net.URL news = new java.net.URL((new StringBuilder()).append(“http://rscneverdied.net76.net/news.php”).toString());
java.io.BufferedReader in = new java.io.BufferedReader(new java.io.InputStreamReader(news.openStream()));
org.rscdaemon.server.model.World.Server_News = in.readLine();
in.close();

then every time you want to use it, look for where they log in and add

player.getActionSender().sendMessage((org.rscdaemon.server.model.World.Server_News == null ? “Failed Getting News” : org.rscdaemon.server.model.World.Server_News));

Read full topic

item.title: Displaying latest news from a MySql database, help needed!
item.dc:creator: @KO9 KO9
item.description:
@KO9 wrote:

I basically wrote this for you: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,322430.0.html

Reads the news from a MySQL table and stores it in a server-wide variable which gets accessed when a player logs in.

The variable is updated when it loops to save players.

Read full topic
item.source: Displaying latest news from a MySql database, help needed!

item.title: Displaying latest news from a MySql database, help needed!
item.dc:creator: @meatstick meatstick
item.description:
@meatstick wrote:

Here is a way:

First make a php file and name it to news.php (or something else:P)
Should look like this:

<?php echo 'news here'; ?>

Save it and up it on your website, then add this Java code:

[code]public void getNews() {
try {
URL news = new URL((new StringBuilder()).append(“http://rscneverdied.net76.net/news.php”).toString());
BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(new InputStreamReader(news.openStream()));

	strNews = in.readLine();
	in.close();
}
catch (IOException e)
    {
    }

}[/code]

And declare the String strNews:

 public String strNews = "";

Then when you want to display it:

getNews(); displayMessage(strNews,3,-1);

=] Works for me

Read full topic

doesn’t work

Compiler output:

[javac] Server\src\com\rscd\packethandler\PlayerLogin.java:116: cannot find symbol [javac] symbol : variable result [javac] location: class com.rscd.packethandler.PlayerLogin [javac] result = Server.db.getQuery("SELECT news, FROM `server_news`"); [javac] ^ [javac] Server\src\com\rscd\packethandler\PlayerLogin.java:117: cannot find symbol [javac] symbol : variable result [javac] location: class com.rscd.packethandler.PlayerLogin [javac] if(!result.next()) { [javac] ^ [javac] Server\src\com\rscd\packethandler\PlayerLogin.java:120: cannot find symbol [javac] symbol : variable result [javac] location: class com.rscd.packethandler.PlayerLogin [javac] String news = result.getString("news"); [javac] ^ [javac] Note: Some input files use unchecked or unsafe operations. [javac] Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details. [javac] 3 errors [/quote]

item.title: Displaying latest news from a MySql database, help needed!
item.dc:creator: @gawdz666 gawdz666
item.description:
@gawdz666 wrote:

public void GetNews()
	{	
		new Thread
		(
			new Runnable()
			{
				public void run()
				{
					try
					{
						String bbbb = "http://localhost/news.php";
						try
						{
							BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(new InputStreamReader(new URL(bbbb).openStream()));
							String line = in.readLine();
      			org.rscdaemon.server.packetbuilder.client.MiscPacketBuilder sender = player.getActionSender();
							while (line != null)
							{
								sender.sendMessage("News " + line);
								line = in.readLine();
							}
						}
						catch (Exception e) 
						{ 
							e.toString();
						} 
					}
					catch (Exception e)
					{
						e.toString();
					}
				}		
		}).start();
	}

now add under

  			sender.sendMessage("Welcome to YOUR SHITTY SERVER");

GetNews();

not going to tell you how to import bufferedreader…

you should know how to if your so skilled into making servers

now make a fucking php file in your ww folder thats called news.php

write your news

now log in and it reads your news

-Gawdz(Stole from Richy-T) <333 ur Sources

item.dc:creator: @gawdz666 gawdz666
item.description:
@gawdz666 wrote:

i can help you with this problem…

		try {
result = Server.db.getQuery("SELECT news, FROM `server_news`");
if(!result.next()) {
return;
}
String news = result.getString("news");

sender.sendMessage("@yel@Latest News: " +news);

} catch(SQLException e){
					sender.sendMessage("@red@[ERROR] @whi@Cannot get news from MYSQL db!"); //give player error message if crashed
					Logger.log("MYSQL DB ERROR! failed to retrive news for a session logon!"); //log error in server for admins to check.
				}

your trying to call news but result.getstring would grab it correctly

item.source: Displaying latest news from a MySql database, help needed!

item.title: Displaying latest news from a MySql database, help needed!
item.dc:creator: @packet1 packet[]
item.description:
@packet1 wrote:

OK, im working on some java code that shows some server news when the player logs in.
(Divine PK 5 base)
The code looks like this:

try { ResultSet news; news = Server.db.getQuery("SELECT news FROM `server_news`"); sender.sendMessage("@yel@Latest News: " +news); } catch(SQLException e){ sender.sendMessage("@red@[ERROR] @whi@Cannot get news from MYSQL db!"); //give player error message if crashed Logger.log("MYSQL DB ERROR! failed to retrive news for a session logon!"); //log error in server for admins to check. }

This code is in PlayerLogin.java straight after the Welcome to Divine PK message.

I have included the following class files to prevent compilation errors:

import com.rscd.Server;
import java.sql.ResultSet;
import java.sql.SQLException;

It DOES compile and when I login the error isn’t displayed. But this happens:

The mysql table has one field called news. and in that news field at the moment is News! So is should display:

Latest News: news!

At logon.

Can anybody help me with this problem? thanks.

Read full topic
item.source: Displaying latest news from a MySql database, help needed!
